subject: Re: [Read_Alphabet] Newsletter
msgSnippet: I had further thoughts on point 1, I realise that it works for me probably wasn t the most helpful comment. I ve created a page which tests three methods of
messageBody:
I had further thoughts on point 1, I realise that 'it works for me'
probably wasn't the most helpful comment.
I've created a page which tests three methods of displaying QS text in a
browser.

The methods are:
Unicode + Font hints.
Unicode on it's own.
ASCII + Font hints.

The first is the best compromise, the text is Unicode but we tell the
browser which font to use which solves the collision problem.
The second is the 'correct' method since it doesn't require particular
fonts to be installed or special mark up but it's also the most likely
to fail due to code point collisions in the PUA. :(
The third method should display correctly in just about any browser but
if you copy the text you'll get the underlying ascii/latin text.

Ideally all three tests should display the same text on a properly setup
computer.
In the real world if we can find a method which works for most people
then we use that to talk to each other.

I'd like to apologise for the spelling on the page, my ability to write
in QS is not very good yet.

I've uploaded the test page to the Fonts folder, please let me know if
you have any ideas/suggestions/improvements.

I had further thoughts on point 1, I realise that 'it works for me'
probably wasn't the most helpful comment.
I've created a page which tests three methods of displaying QS text in a
browser.

The methods are:
Unicode + Font hints.
Unicode on it's own.
ASCII + Font hints.

The first is the best compromise, the text is Unicode but we tell the
browser which font to use which solves the collision problem.
The second is the 'correct' method since it doesn't require particular
fonts to be installed or special mark up but it's also the most likely
to fail due to code point collisions in the PUA. :(
The third method should display correctly in just about any browser but
if you copy the text you'll get the underlying ascii/latin text.

Ideally all three tests should display the same text on a properly setup
computer.
In the real world if we can find a method which works for most people
then we use that to talk to each other.

I'd like to apologise for the spelling on the page, my ability to write
in QS is not very good yet.

I've uploaded the test page to the Fonts folder, please let me know if
you have any ideas/suggestions/improvements.
